subject: Programming
title: Code Ownership and Ego
description: A quick, practical guide to Code Ownership and Ego.

hook.text: A developer snaps when their code is criticized. They wrote it; the critique feels personal.

buildup.text: Ego attachment to code turns feedback into conflict. My code becomes my identity.

discovery.text: Collective code ownership means the team owns everything. No hero coders, no blame games.

twist.text: Letting go of ownership is hard. Seeing your code rewritten stings even when the result is better.

climax.text: The healthiest teams review code without judging the author. Critique the code, not the person.

punchline.text: You are not your code. The team owns it all.

quiz.question: Why is collective code ownership healthier for teams?
options: It removes blame and encourages shared improvement
It means less code is written
It eliminates the need for testing
